Reviews.Title: “Great location but incredibly noisy”
Reviews.Author: caroline_away
Reviews.Content: Misafir is undoubtedly in fantastic location but the noise level is extraordinary - and unrelenting every night (we were there across both weekend and weeknights - the live music from next door seems to be popular every night and morning of the week). We wouldn't have slept in any meaningful way for the three nights we were there. Ideal for those who would like to be out till 4 or 5 every night; more challenging for people who want to see Istanbul during the day. The rooms are enormous and have great bathrooms and spare couches, desks etc, and are nicely decorated, which makes a nice change from small hotel rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Pure bliss at Misafir!”
Reviews.Author: SorDubai
Reviews.Content: I spent a week at Misafir suites. And from the day I arrived to the day I left, the team at the hotel made my stay as comfortable and pleasant as possible. As for the hotel itself, the room was absolutely terrific with the location being right at the heart of Taksim square. If anybody wants to go to Istanbul, I would highly recommend Misafir to you! On my next trip to Istanbul, I will most definitely stay at the hotel again. There is a very nice restaurant on the roof of the hotel which is quite a hotspot with the locals. I unfortunately only went there on my last day but I would highly recommend it. On a final, I want to send a special thanks to Goker and the rest of the guys who very helpful!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful but LOUD”
Reviews.Author: aziobro
Reviews.Content: The contemporary design of the spacious rooms was amazing. The constant pounding noise from the music clubs along the street is unbearable, especially at 2:30 in the morning. Not a place for the a restful night sleep.

Reviews.Title: “i was feeling beeing guest among friends”
Reviews.Author: NatassaAthina
Reviews.Content: The location of the hotel is in a centered neighborhood very closed to many eating places,bars,shops and many other "hot spots" of the city in addition with the service provided by the hotel personnel who are efficient and always smiling and very helpful made my stay in Istanbul "unforgettable"

Reviews.Title: “Huge beautiful suite in old building but VERY noisy - near nightclub”
Reviews.Author: hibachi
Reviews.Content: This is a great choice (with one big caveat) for someone who wants to be in the middle of the Istiklal Caddesi neighborhood and not in a regular hotel. This is an old apartment building that's been converted to a suites hotel. Pros: - rooms are enormous: very large main room combined bedroom & sitting area, beautiful bathroom, huge comfortable bed, high ceilings, living room area with two full size couches, tall old windows that open out. Very clean. Lots of local magazines left out to read. - Turkish breakfast included in price, brought to you room on request every morning. - apartment building feel: big interior staircase, apartment style elevator. - great location for food and streetside entertainment. This is not a tourist neighborhood, unlike the "old city" neighborhoods around Hagia Sophia -- although there are plenty of tourists so you won't feel out of place, this area is mostly for locals. 5-7 min walk to Taksim Square, or walk the other direction down Istiklal to the tower. A few minutes walking to any number of restaurants from small casual street-facing places to top-notch high end places. Istiklal is hopping with locals and tourists every night of the week until the wee hours....you can just walk down the street and get an eyeful. - owners & staff at the suites were all helpful and welcoming. They can give recommendations for restaurants, shopping, arrange for taxis etc. Two downsides: - at present, there's no onsite bar / restaurant. In my opinion, this isn't a big deal, since there are bars & restaurants everywhere just steps outside. The main drawback & it's huge: there's a nightclub right across the little alley and the club blares music every night (not just weekends) until about 3 pm. It's INSANELY loud, even with windows closed and heavy curtains drawn. I'm not sensitive to noise -- I regularly travel to New York & other places that are known for their street noise -- but I've never been in a room this noisy. I didn't bring any earplugs....tried to sleep in my airplane noise-reducing headphones which helped a little but wasn't comfortable. I suppose if you lived here, you'd get used to it, but even after a week I hadn't adjusted. So I ended the week with big bags under my eyes and that stoned feeling you get from sleep deprivation. Bottom line: I loved everything about this place other than the nightclub issue, but I don't think I stay there again -- I'm old enough to really need my beauty sleep. Too bad because otherwise it's a great place & the noise is a difficult problem for the owners to solve.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel is very close to the hustle...”
Reviews.Author: DoubleALondon
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very close to the hustle and bustle of istiklal cadessi and you can't escape the noise from the local bars and clubs. Don't stay here if you want a quiet night. For night owls the location is excellent. The staff are very knowledgable and had great itinerary and restaurant recomendations.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Service”
Reviews.Author: stino9495
Reviews.Content: The rooms at this hotel are huge, well appointed, and very comfortable. The staff, most notably concierge extraordanaire Goker, are friendly, knowledgeable, and great for getting the inside scoop on Istanbul. The area where this hotel is located is loud, quite loud actually, But that is the the trade off for being right in the heart of Taksim. Ask for a room at the back of the hotel and it shouldn't be an issue. Definitely would recommend this place.

Reviews.Title: “Great suites, great location. Definitely recommend it.”
Reviews.Author: Francie007
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Misafir Suites two nights in March 2010. The suite is very spacious and luxury. The interior of the suites is very stylish with amongst others a great bed, lounge sofa and desk for you laptop. Excellent and free wifi, flatscreen TV, dvd-player, etc. The bathroom is spacious as well with a huge bath and luxury bath accessoires. The location is great as well. When you exit the building you're right in the heart of everything (bars, restaurants, shops, etc.). And you even don't have to leave the building, because the owner runs a great restaurant/club in the building. And yes, it is a bit noisy, but that goes with the central location. If I return to Istanbul I will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “it's worth it!!!”
Reviews.Author: alenorse
Reviews.Content: Very good place, big rooms, correct staff and spectacular neighborhood.

Reviews.Title: “Head and shoulders above the rest”
Reviews.Author: gfogal
Reviews.Content: Sadly, finding a quality lodging in Istanbul can be quite difficult for foreigners, since all hotels, even those on the bottom rung, claim to be 3 or 4 stars. The rating system in Turkey is completely unregulated, and even TripAdvisor ratings have to be used with caution as many hotels will 'stuff the ballot box', if you know what I mean. This was our fifth stay in Instanbul and we decided to stay outside of the touristy Sultanahmet area and stay in the Taksim Suare area instead. By taking the tram we still had easy access to the Blue Mosque, Hagia Sophia, etc., but with a better choice of hotels and restaurants. What a surprise we had with Misafir Suites! The rooms are huge, and everything works. The service was top notch and the hotel restaurant was exquisite. The owners are Danish, and this shows in the quality and style of room furnishings. Yes this place is a bit pricey, but do yourself a favor and stay here at least once. I would pick this place over the Four Seasons, even without price as a factor. Very nice place indeed.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic, highly recommended, would stay here again!”
Reviews.Author: Glamanda
Reviews.Content: We split our stay in Istanbul between Sultanahmet so we could walk to all the sights and Beyoglu (Misafir) for NYE and the last 3 nights of our Turkey holiday and we were not disappointed! The suite was huge (65sqm), loved the L'Occitane toiletries and the decor. The beds were very comfortable and breakfast was good (delievered to your room, not buffet so you're not in danger of over-eating which leaves room for many other delicious Turkish treats in the surrounding streets!). The guys at reception gave us excellent recommendations for food (must go to the meyhanes near the hotel for dinner and/or beers). We had pre-booked NYE dinner at Changa (by ourselves, not suggested by the hotel) which was a huge disappointment - YTL50 for a very dry piece of lamb served in charcoal burnt vine leaves with sour cream and sweet chilli sauce?? Pretty ordinary for a top restaurant! The owner, Joost, was very hospitable - spotted us heading out to dinner and invited us to the bar for a pre-dinner NYE champagne (complimentary). We ended up going back for a drink after our disappointing dinner for NYE. Location is excellent, perfect for wandering through the streets and stumbling upon boutiques or bars. If you want to sight-see, you will need to take the metro which is about a 7 mins walk from the hotel. If we were coming back to this part of Istanbul, we would definitely stay here again and are recommending it all our friends!

Reviews.Title: “A trendy boutique hotel in vibrant neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: marxover
Reviews.Content: Traveling to Istanbul regularly, the Misafir quickly came out to be my favourite place in town for 3 main reasons: (i) Rooms en suite are bigger than anything a five stars hotel would offer for the same price, yet providing the same type of comfort (internet, mimibar, sat TV, etc..); (ii) Rooftop (spring and summer) and groundfloor trendy bar/restaurant are great places to chill out and enjoy good food and music; (iii) located in the heart of Beyoglu, the Misafir is a must for people in their 30's/40's, not travelling with kids, willing to discover vibrant Istanbul and enjoy the whole lot this city has to offer. Within walking distance you'll find great bars, restaurants and plenty of shopping options. Main touristic attraction are easily reachable by taxi or tramways.

Reviews.Title: “definitely recommended!”
Reviews.Author: cinas
Reviews.Content: Staying at Misafirsuites has been an incredible way to experience Istanbul. Located in the hippest neighborhood, with their incredible food, amazing service and beautiful ambiance, I should admit that never expected this much and was quiet surprised by the quality of highest standards. I say definitely go for it!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect spot to rest and relax”
Reviews.Author: traveler74Seattle_WA
Reviews.Content: Couldn't say better things about the hotel and location - well-situated in a good neighborhood and easily accessible by public transit. The staff was always helpful, and the room was fantastic - surprisingly big with all of the amenities you could want. Breakfast was also great. As mentioned in some other reviews, it can be a little loud, but we didn't find this to be a hugeh problem. (Worth considering if you're a light sleeper or are traveling with kids.)

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: Armavef
Reviews.Content: - very warm welcome from the staff of the hotel - great explanations and restaurants tips - very good breakfast - very nice design of the rooms (a little bit too noisy)

Reviews.Title: “Very satisfied!!!”
Reviews.Author: Taksidiaris
Reviews.Content: I stayed with my girlfriend in Misafir Suites during November. We really found it excellent. Room was very big. The bed was fantastic. Bathroom was really clean. Finally the staff helps you a lot (information for sightseeing, bookings for restaurants etc.). I fully recommend Misafir suites.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, shame about the racket”
Reviews.Author: Bond059
Reviews.Content: Misafir Suites would be a really nice hotel, the staff are pleasant and helpful and the rooms generous BUT it sits on top of a noisy club/bar and is sandwiched in between two other clubs. The noise at night is really unbearable with pounding music continuing into the early hours. If you like sleep this isnâ€™t the place for you. A real shame with so much going for it otherwise.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place in Great Locale”
Reviews.Author: WarrenNewYorkCity
Reviews.Content: We had two huge rooms in Istanbul's hottest neighborhood. Tourist attractions were a short tram ride away and at night we were literally in the middle of all the action. Highest rated restaurants were within walking distance. Bedroom had king size bed, flat screen TV, and dvd player. Bathroom was large. Room was a little noisy, so you may want to consider elsewhere if you're a light sleeper.

Reviews.Title: “A true gem”
Reviews.Author: aberkeley
Reviews.Content: Excellent location, one block away from the vibrant Istiklal Ave. Amazingly huge room with super modern furniture. Friendly staff! Would visit again! highly recommended....

Reviews.Title: “Trendiest boutique hotel in Istanbul for the in-the-know world traveller”
Reviews.Author: sab294
Reviews.Content: I've been to Istanbul many times, and have stayed at all the usual top names hotels (Cigragan, 4 Season, Marmara, etc). This time we decided to stay in Misafir Suites, and couldn't have been happier with our choice. Located in the heart of downtown Istanbul, this gem of a boutique hotel is the definition of cool. We were within seconds of the best bars/cafes/nightclubs Istanbul had to offer. The hotel bar, Sekiz (8), is one of the trendiest bar/lounges in Istanbul. 50 Cent was partying with his friends the night we were there. Amazing staff, very slick and cool rooms, great value and unbeatable location. All in all, if you want to stay somewhere with an urban/cool vibe and not some franchise hotel then MIsafir Suites is definetlly for you.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel - much better than top rating trip advisor hotel - Sirkeci Konak”
Reviews.Author: lifeisbeaut
Reviews.Content: We went to Istanbul twice in the same month (at beginning and end of trip) - around 4 nights at Sirkeci Konak and 5 nights at Misafir Suites. Sirkeci Konak is top rating hotel on Trip advisor but this is really only due to numbers as Misafir suites only has 6 rooms. Misafir suites is a million times better. The rooms are absolutely huge and also very nice and well decorated. The marble bathroom is great as is the bath and accompaniments provided. The staff we dealt with provided lots of information. I strongly advise getting airport transfer as taxi drivers can't find the place. The location couldn't be any better - it is just off the main street. When one steps outside one's door there is also a whole lot of small bars on the street all with live folk music - so one can pick a different one every day. I highly recommend staying on this side of town rather than Sultahnmet as there is excellent food, bars, night atmosphere etc on this side of town and one doesn't want to travel from one's hotel on the other side of town just to eat. If one wants to see the sights in Sultahnmet it is easy to catch either the Tunel or Funicular one stop and then the tram - you will be there in 15 minutes. We stayed at the hotel for 5 nights and only one of those nights was noisy as there was a party at the hotel bar - but this was unusual and the street noise is not bad at all - however, this may be because we stayed on the other side of the hotel (at the back) where it is not facing the bars with music (room 6) - so I recommend you stay on this side of hotel. I seriously don't know why this isn't the top rating hotel in Istanbul - but like I said, probably due to the fact that it only has 6 rooms and many people staying are attending conferences etc so they may not write to Trip Advisor. Sure, it doesn't have the facilities of a five star hotel in terms of pool, gym etc - but if you're not into that stuff then why pay for it. If the room is the most important thing to you then this is the hotel to stay in - the room was absolutely perfect - huge room, huge bed, big bathroom, all plush. I will stay here again 100% when I return to Istanbul. Sirkeci Konak we found to be nice in terms of location and cleanliness - but location here is even better and cleanliness is the same but rooms are way better and eating options are 100 times better.

Reviews.Title: “Spacious, chic boutique hotel in trendy neighborhood with great service”
Reviews.Author: konadoodlemom
Reviews.Content: Three of us (couple + 18-year-old) spent four days in Istanbul at the end of May at the Misafir Suites. The room was incredibly large - queen bed, two leather couches, desk, mini-refrigerator, storage, and plenty of room for a rollaway bed. The bathroom was marble and stocked with L'Occitane amenities. Staff were incredibly friendly and welcoming, and very helpful with directions, ferry schedules, restaurant suggestions, etc. Breakfast was served in the first-floor restaurant, a choice of about 5 different options, with fresh-squeezed juice, coffee and house-baked bread. The hotel is very conveniently situated, a short walk from the Taksim funicular and metro stations, which provide access all over the city. Taxis are also readily available. There was some construction going on during our stay, but the staff made every effort to keep the mess out of our way, and to keep things quiet when we were in our room. The only negative was the noise from some of the nearby nightlife, which even the double-glazed windows and heavy drapes couldn't entirely keep out. We're hoping to return soon!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Istanbul Hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: GMEDurham
Reviews.Content: The Misafir Suites are wonderfully situated in Beyoglu, minutes from Taxim Square, the great pedestrian mall Istiklal Cadezi, and the funicular to the tram connecting you to the sights in Sultanamet. Lots of restaurants nearby and and Orham Pamuk's neighborhood is walking distance also. So location is great. Service is beyond great. The staff are so helpful, so nice, they'll give you maps, look things up, make reservations for you, hold luggage if you leave Istanbul for a few days and then return, whatever you need. The hotel restaurant is very very good. An eclectic menu that includes Pad Thai and Satay. (Really) And it's delicious. The included Turkish breakfast is very nice and plenty substantial. The rooms are beautiful -- spacious and tastefully appointed. Pilows are comfortable, there are plenty of hangers, and there is a safe in the room. I can't say enough about how wonderful this place was. You'll love it.

Reviews.Title: “Fab rooms, excellent location, top service”
Reviews.Author: adriana61
Reviews.Content: In the best part of Istanbul for shopping, dining and partying we found this gem: Misafir Suites. Spacious, beautifully decorated rooms, very private, yet in the middle of bustling Beyoglu. Super helpful staff, great (hip) downstairs restaurant, bar, lounge where you can have breakfast, lunch and dinner. We simply had 5 super days in Istanbul and especially in Misafir Suites

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, friendly staff, wonderful room, one enormous drawback.”
Reviews.Author: Silveryj
Reviews.Content: This is a lovely boutique hotel which I booked largely on the strength of the reviews on this site, the location, and the hotel website. It has six suites. I stayed on the second floor. It had a large sofa, a chaise longue, a small dining table, two beds, a queen and a full sized, air conditioning, a lot of closet space, a huge bathroom with jacuzzi tub and a large writing desk. It was surrounded on three out of four sides with windows. It was a great room. I loved it. The free breakfast which comes with your stay is also amazing. I took the Turkish traditional breakfast every morning, while my husband usually had an omelette. We were there for three nights. Sadly, we could not wait to leave. Why? Because, and you need to believe me here, the room is so unbelieveably noisy that neither one of us could sleep. It is next door to a nightclub that is open until between two and four in the morning, and the music and crowd noise never stop. Never. Traffic noise being what it is in Istanbul, and being that the hotel is one block from Istikal Cadessi, you do expect a certain amount of noise, but this is seriously ungodly loud. And I live in New York, in the Village, in the middle of NYU--I know what loud traffic and pedestrian noise is. Overall, the hotel is close to perfect, but I can't recommend it unless you're deaf or dead. Let me repeat. I read some reviews on here that mentioned the noise and I disregarded them. DO NOT MAKE THIS MISTAKE.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location and helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: ZAK12003
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Misafir Suites after reading all the great reviews about the hotel. First of all the location is brilliant if you want to be in the middle of all the hustle and bustle. It is located in the Taxim area which is very touristy. The good thing is either day or night you can step out and be a part of the masses. You will like this hotel if you prefer staying at smaller properties. It has a more apartment like feel which I generally favor. The room was large with a sitting area and bed in one room. The bathroom was clean and modern. Housekeeping was efficient, restocking all the amenities. The breakfast was average, nothing to write home about so I would step out to one of the nearby cafÃ©â€™s in the morning. I didnâ€™t have any issues with the noise level, though if you are a light sleeper this is not the place for you. The best part of this hotel was the staff. They were extremely helpful and had a great attitude. Everyone spoke fluent English and they knew the area well. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “By far the best boutique hotel I have stayed in”
Reviews.Author: mara_torres
Reviews.Content: From start to finish, everything was perfect there, I wish I could go back, but they are out rooms for a long time in advance. What a great place.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful modern room with chaos outside the door.”
Reviews.Author: EBreedlove
Reviews.Content: Stayed in Misafir for one night on the way out of town. We arrived around 2:30 pm, and our room wasn't ready. We were told the other guests had Â¨checked out lateÂ¨ and the front desk person was very apologetic. It took an extra 45 mins to clean (though they told us it would only be 15 mins more), which was very frustrating. The front staff were nice and tried to be accomodating, but I didn't find them to be overly helpful or professional. We asked for a map and some information about the area while we waited, but they had to send someone down the street to photocopy a map, which also took 30 mins. The restaurant recommendations they gave were to horribly touristy and boring places, and when we arrived at their restaurant in the morning the front staff person was alseep at a table, clearly having just recently arrived himself from a night of partying. The restaurant is nice, and we had a hot breakfast made to order, which is a nice change over the standard hotel buffet fare. The room was gorgeous, very modern, large, and comfortable. The bathroom was fabulous. The location is great for shopping and bar/restaurant hopping, BUT (a huge but) the place is located in the heart of the disco/bar area. There was a club with extremely loud music on every corner right around us. Nothing quieted down until about 5 am. Forget sleeping well unless you can sleep well with a giant party raging within a few feet of your pillow. Overall, for the money we spent, I expected more professional service. I would much rather have stayed somewhere a bit quieter.

Reviews.Title: “My home away from home”
Reviews.Author: igz
Reviews.Content: I have been staying at Misafir Suites almost every month since September 2008. The hotel is located at Beyoglu (at the European Side) and you can experience the 'real' Instanbul which begins almost as you step out of the front door. The staff are exremely attentive and happy to accomodate even the most 'fusy' traveler. At the bottom of the hotel you can also find '8' which is a restaurant/bar. It belongs to the hotel and serves fantastic light meals and drinks until the morning. In my opinion, Misafir Suites ranks among the best hotels of Istanbul! Ilias, Athens - Greece

Reviews.Title: “At the pulse of the city”
Reviews.Author: AmalfiRegina
Reviews.Content: Likes- bathtub, over-sized suites, extremely comfortable mattress, the fluffy duvet and the restaurant. dislikes- the noise from the streets.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: yc93
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Misafir Suites for 4 nights in August. The rooms are among the nicest I've seen in Turkey, very spacious with fabulous bathroom and extremely comfortable bed. The concierge was extremely knowledgable, helpuful and pleasant. Although the restaurant was closed while we were there, a delicious breakfast was delivered to our room every morning. We really liked the location -- it was easy to get around to the historical sites, but not inundated with tourists. Although the streets are extremely lively until very late at night/early in the morning, our room at the back of the hotel was quiet. I highly recommend the Misafir Suites!

Reviews.Title: “a wonderful refuge in our long journey”
Reviews.Author: rebar8
Reviews.Content: We absolutely loved our stay at Misafire Suites. They were so welcoming and accomodating, especially given that we were travelling with a young child, and provided wonderful service. The suite itself was beautiful and spacious. The onsight restaurant was great, and a delicious breakfast is included with your stay.We enjoyed the location, and we were very happy to have chosen to stay outside of Sultanahmet for this visit to Istanbul. The only caveat is that because of the location in the thick of the city, there is noise from the street in the evening. We had no problem with this because we are accustomed to urban living, but a very light sleeper or someone sensitive to noise might not be a good match for this lovely establishment.

Reviews.Title: “Misafir Suites, my favorite hotel in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: Someren
Reviews.Content: Last week I have visited Misafir Suites, the most beautiful hotel in Istanbul. We have booked 1 double room and we were very pleased with the large but cosy room, very hip and trendy atmosphere. The bathroom was all I have ever dreamed about! We had great service during our stay of 4 days, breakfast in the hotel restaurant (it is called 8) was excellent. Also the dinner at night was very, very good, of the 4 nights we staid in Istanbul, 3 nights we had dinner in the hotel restaurant, the menu was too nice to only have eaten here 1-2 times! Nice personnel, very friendly people at the reception, very helpfull with all questions we had, just some extra service which makes it worth while coming here again. I really enjoy Istanbul every time we come her, but by visiting Misafir Suites it becomes even better! I would recommend this hotel to all of my friends, the hotel is situated in the middle of the city centre. They have pick-up service from the Airport and the team of Misafir Suites do everything to make your stay worth while. Thank you very much for our wonderfull stay, we will definitely come again!

Reviews.Title: “very nice hotel, great service”
Reviews.Author: ezraulo
Reviews.Content: highly recommend this hotel. the concierge/hotel attendant/all around guy (his name is eren) was excellent. very attentive and accommodating. can't say anything but compliments for the guy. decor was very clean and modern, with each room designed differently which adds to the interest of the space. the restaurant was being renovated while we were there so not sure about the food or the scene or the potential noise from the music. but hopefully that's no trouble. the gas was turned off on our last day so no hot water. not sure if this was hotel-specific or if it affected the whole area, but the hotel offered a discount to compensate for the inconvenience. all in all, a very good experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great city stay”
Reviews.Author: t50
Reviews.Content: Very pleasant well run hotel with huge rooms and amongst the most comfortable beds that I have experienced. Had no problems with noise in spite of the narrowness of the streets and the number of restaurants etc round about. Easy to get to Sultanahmet by whichever means you fancy and Beyoglu itself is lively with plenty of choice in restaurants and shops.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed the Beyoglu neighborhood off the beaten tourist path”
Reviews.Author: lovetravelmidwest
Reviews.Content: This is a nice boutique hotel in the extremely busy Beyoglu neighborhood. We liked the neighborhood because it was not in a tourist area and we were able to get a feel for everyday life. It was convenient to get a taxi and had some good restaurants close by. Our room was really large, nicely decorated and very clean. The front desk was very helpful in answering our questions and showing us places on the map. The hotel is in a very busy neighborhood and is located on some small alleys. Our room was located in the back of the hotel and we kept the air conditioning on high to block out some of the noise of the bars during the night. If you want a quiet room and a big American hotel, this is not for you. The owner is very aware of the noise, but he isn't able to do anything else about it now. We stayed here for 3 nights in May. We enjoyed the breakfast of toast, cheese, tomatoes, olives and cucumbers, but the limited menu would get old after too many days. There is no pool and there really is no lobby, except for the desk where you check in. We didn't care about either of these because we were busy seeing the city and our room was very comfortable to hang out at night when we returned to the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great spot”
Reviews.Author: gibsonia
Reviews.Content: Unsure of where to stay in Istanbul we opted for the Taksim area. The hotel is newly appointed. The staff was great, booked reservations for us (and we always got a great table), printed out maps for us etc. I just can't say enough about how nice the staff was. The rooms are big with wonderful linens, marble baths, sofa, table and chairs. Breakfast served in-room within 15min. of calling for it. It is rowdy in Taksim so if you are a light sleeper it might be a problem (our rooms faced the street/club). Short walk to Taksim square transportation depot.

Reviews.Title: “Great choice”
Reviews.Author: uskuhlmans
Reviews.Content: I would add my recommendation to all the others. It is a good value and excellent location. The staff is incredibly helpful and concerned about guests. Very good value for the money.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic boutique hotel!”
Reviews.Author: sleepyhead81
Reviews.Content: Stayed two nights in the HUGE suite at Misafir suites and loved the room. Entering the reception area it is a bit disappointing first impression but the room soon makes it up. Very central location just 200 m from the main shopping street. Noise was not a problem for me but I understand it can be as the hotel is located in very narrow alleys. Friendly owner who makes good recommendation for restaurants or the coolest bar at the moment.

Reviews.Title: “Best room ever...but just that”
Reviews.Author: xeti
Reviews.Content: I just stayed for four nights at the misafir suites with two friends. I travel a lot for business and pleasure and have been in great hotels. The best hotel room I have ever stayed at. Very large - we could have stayed 5 people with no problem! - , attention to detail, laid-back chic, simple decoration but really beautiful. Spotless marble bathrooms and a fantastic bathtub. Location is in the heart of Beyoglu which comes very handy for bars and restaurants _try Zarifi nearby_ amazing Turkish food with a modern twist at excellent value _and within easy reach of main sights by public transport. but But ...the hotel is cornered between narrow alleys and surrounded by live music bars, and Turkish people truly like their music until the early hours ! If you want to join the party and go to bed at sunrise or you sleep undisturbed like a log, this place it's the perfect spot for you. If you plan relatively quiet early nights or have light sleep forget about it. There is little staff can do about noise. Although smiley however they are totally unprofessional. Reception is more often empty than not, breakfast for us took ages to arrive-40 minutes on average -and it ends up being a bit repetitive. It feels really like home - during carnival season- but because you do not see anyone and have to sort out any problems that come up. Even a small hotel like this needs someone to manage it properly and put a bit more attention to detail outside the beautiful rooms. With less noise at night and competent staff, it would be a gem. But from my recent experience I would not recommend it to any of my friends.

Reviews.Title: “loved my stay”
Reviews.Author: facebookster
Reviews.Content: Visited Istanbul for the first time. We were supposed to get a car pick up from the airport by Misafir Suites but they forgot or could not get a car. This was a big problem and we were very angry but got in a cab and called the hotel after which the cab driver spoke to the hotel reception and found the hotel. We reached the hotel about 9:00 am. Upon reaching the hotel, staff was very very friendly and upon check in showed us the various attractions in Istanbul and served breakfast which was very good. the only problem was that we could not get a room because we had gotten there early and had to wait in the bar which was very nice until 1:00 pm. During this time, their staff gurkin or something his name was stayed with us and kept us company. We were then given the room and the room was amazing, it was spacious, clean and absolutely wonderful. After this, everything about the hotel was 5 star ++ Staff was always friendly Breakfast was served anytime we wanted even in the room Hotel room was cleaned almost every time we left the room Tv had over 500 channels Room was noisy in the sense that there was a lot of noise that came from the street downstairs but that is the one bad thing about staying in a very popular spot. Location is everything and there cannot be a better location than this hotel since it is in the middle of Istikal which is like a main street full of life and fun. All in all, loved the hotel, location and everything.

Reviews.Title: “Happy New Year”
Reviews.Author: Lars-Olof
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Misafir Suites over New Years and we had a great time. The room was beautiful, large and well equipped, very cozy with a touch of luxury. We were very well taken care of by the owners and the staff, the service was magnificent. We spent a great New Years eve in the restaurant at the hotel, the food, the drinks and the atmosphere was absolutely wonderful. When we return to Istanbul we will definitely stay at MisafirÂ´Suites.

Reviews.Title: “Didn't Want to Leave the Room”
Reviews.Author: ExpatBulgaria
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in the best location for cheap eats, mehanes (taverns) and the buzz of Turkey. Visit the tourist sites by short taxi during the day and then come back to this hotel in the heart of Taksim. The rooms are large (suite size) and extremely comfortable - after a hard day visiting the sites there is enough room to grab one of the many choices of food sold on the street nearby and open a bottle of red in the room if you feel like it. The bathroom is also lovely with good quality toiletries and a decent hairdryer. It has a fantastic oversized bathtub to relax in - only downside - the shower is over the bath, which although common in Europe, is maybe not so great if you are an older person, especially as it is so big, making it hard to step into. Two other points to be aware of - this hotel is in the heart of Istanbul's nightlife area so expect some nightclub noise at night. Also, the hotel is located in a sort of back alley off the main pedestranised strip, so sometimes taxis will drop you a short walk from the hotel and you may have trouble explaining to them where to drop you. As others have said - the breakfasts are lovely - fresh juice, cheese, olives, cucumber and the host, and the service generally, were both super. This hotel is a little on the expensive side compared to other Istanbul hotels but it is a high standard. Also, as a general point Istanbul itself is not that cheap - although the currency is Turkish Lira - on conversion to Euro, things seemed to work out to cost about the same as they would in a Eurozone country. I am not exactly sure why it is listed as a 'B&B' on Trip Advisor - don't let this put you off if you are a person who dislikes B&Bs (like me) - it's a hotel (albeit privately owned). The only problem we found with this room was that it was so comfortable we didn't want to leave it!

Reviews.Title: “Magnificent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: suzi-mnde
Reviews.Content: Beautifully restored building,cozy lively place. Ä° reserved MisafirSuites after i read about it in NY Times.True suites, large, a modern, feel good decoration, it was great. Service is fast and excellent.The bar downstairs is the coolest place,its not like a hotel bar, its mainly turkish customers, you can hang out for hours, drink, eat, look at people, great music too. The prices are convenient better than any 5 star hotel and it includes everything even internet and breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: Shanghaisol
Reviews.Content: We couldn't have been happier with choosing Misafir as our Istanbul lodging. It's nicely tucked away on a little street just off the main (and pedestrian-busy) Istikal Street. If you need to find it on your own: It's about a five-minute walk from Taksim Square. As you walk down Istikal from Taksim Square, look for a Benetton store on your right. You'll then see on your right a single tree (in front of a mosque). Turn left on the small cross street directly across from this tree (there was a Swatch shop on the corner as well). Then take the first mini street to your right. Misafir is the first entrance on your left (there isn't a sign - ring the bell if the doorman isn't sitting outside). If you're looking for a boutique hotel that's off the beaten tourist track, this is a great place for you. Lots of nightlife, and street music/activity continues until the wee hours. We're not late-nighters, but we enjoyed the activity as we walked around after dinner. The music was audible from our room, but it didn't disturb our sleep a bit. Joost, the Dutch owner, is very hospitable. He was just opening a very attractive bar/restaurant on Misafir's first floor as we were finishing our four-night stay. Take bar soap and washclothes, if these are important to you. Hairdryer and all other personal care items provided. A few convenience shops nearly next door to Misafir for odds and ends. Tip: You can get New Turkish Lira, Euros and US$ from some ATMs - most notably the HSBC machines. There is an HSBC ATM immediately to your left upon exiting the international arrivals hall. There are also at least two near Misafir. One is next to the Benetton store (kitty corner from the Body Shop) on Istikal Street (if walking onto Istikal Street from Misafir, turn right). There's another HSBC ATM tucked away on a nearby side street. Turn left onto Istikil Street upon exiting Misafir; walk left for a while and start checking the side streets to the right. It's on the right immediately after you turn onto the side street, so you'll see it right away if you're on the right street.

Reviews.Title: “Cool at the Centre”
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the Misafir for a week in September - when arriving first it is a bit disconcerting as the driver has to navigate through all these small streets to get you to the Hotel - hence why they include the ariport transfer in the rate as I dont think any regular taxi driver would be able to find it. If you are dont know Istanbul you are in the heart of Beygolu a 5 minute walk from Taksim Square which is a very lively area of the City night and day. Yet is is convenient for getting to the Old City and finding non touristy restaurants and lively evening venues. Istanbul is a very intense busy city and the Misafir Suites are your oasis in the middle of all the craziness. While at the moment there are only 6 rooms I bellieve there are plans for 3 more and for a bar Restaurant which was under construction. The Misafir is run by a Dutch Guy called Joost and the attention to detail in the contemporary spacious rooms is fantastic. you will also get complimentary WiFi access and complimentary breakfast each morning in your room. The staff are all very freindly and nothing is too much trouble.I really enjoyed my stay here and I will let the photos speak for themselves with regards to the quality of the room. If you want to be in the centre of the action in Istanbul in a quality environment - my recommendation dont stay anywhere else. Enjoy Istanbul a great city

Reviews.Title: “Very Pleasing Hotel of Quality and Convenience”
Reviews.Author: li0nel
Reviews.Content: We were in Ä°stanbul with my husband and 3 of our friends and we all adored the place.Ä° mean the hotel is perfectly placed in the little streets of beyoglu who is 2 minutes away from Ä°stanbul's most crazy avenue (Ä°stiklal Cadde)of shops,bars and restaurants. The service is very personalized,trained and fast.They arranged a really nice little anniversary party in our room without any problems.Unfortunately there restaurant was under construction. Actually the rooms are so big that you can throw a party in them,with all sort of gadgets (like dvd players,playstation on request) and elegantly decorated. All this came with a really great price,a bargain,all the other 5 star hotels that we checked before coming were almost twice the price tag.Ä° think for sophisticated tourist who is looking for an unique experience this is the place to go.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Boutique Hotel in The Best Location”
Reviews.Author: NattaLi
Reviews.Content: We read about Misafir in NYTimes and booked it for our 1 week vacation.The paper mentioned that it was stylish and hip for good prices.First of all it is in the center of the city and I think if we stayed in any other part of the city it would have been a less gratifing experience.There is all this young and hip bars and restaurants in the neighbourhood. The hotel is very well decorated stylish and modern which makes you feel good,with the eastern touch.And the rooms I cannot praise them enough,so big and comfortable. Breakfast, free wireless connection are included in a very humble price.The service is fast, friendly and willing so we will go back and recommend to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Thank you Joost!”
Reviews.Author: travelbug10012
Reviews.Content: Thank you Joost for making our trip to Istanbul so worthwhile. Your taste is impeccable and you have furnished your hotel with obvious care down to the finest details. I have never stayed in a hotel where the mini-bar did not charge exorbitant prices. Thank you for allowing us to pay normal prices for drinks and snacks when we returned to our immaculately kept rooms. This hotel has beautiful bathrooms and state of the art everything...including DVD players and flat screened TVs. The bed linens and comfort of the beds was a welcome retreat at night. The staff and Joost (owner) were extremely helpful to all of our needs, whether it be suggesting a restaurant or tour guide (Yener, who was our guide for a day was fantastic). The hotel is located in a fun, funky part of town, accessible to all of Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely incredible”
Reviews.Author: NewYorkJag
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I loved our stay at the MiSafir Suites - only problem was that the stay was too short! Joost and his staff were incredible hosts, very helpful and very willing to assist us in choosing our sightseeing for each day without being intrusive at all. As other reviews have said, the rooms are absolutely amazing in their style and elegance - dare i say it there was almost too much space! A great hotel, run by great people means an incredible experience. everyone should stay here if they can.
